attributes.action: abolish car tax and replace with increased petrol tax (c.6p per litre)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Abolishing car tax and increasing petrol tax would save the cost of collection, mean that all users would pay, reduce the cost of chasing car tax crime and reduce crime and costs of courts. (In 2005, 57bn litres fuel were consumed, and £4bn ved collected in 2003. I have assumed that .6Bn£ would be saved in administration)
In rural areas without good public transport, the fuel tax could be reduced, or vendors subsidies.
It would also encourage a lower use of cars, and driving more economically, and more efficient cars.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
